poem:
Title: Under the Joy's Mask

Dread casts its long shadow,
on the holly-hued morning.
A specter haunting the Yuletide cheer,
in every cough, every jest.
The hearth is warmer, yet somber.
Intangible enemy lingers,
like winter mist on the mourner's coat.
Such unwanted gift under the Yule tree. 
A festive pageant of statistics and sorrow,
Yet, we find strength, in the gentle
echo of carols against the cold.
